column2: Silver Hand of Nuada
column3: Main d'argent de Nuada

column2: This ornate prosthetic hand is crafted from purest silver and covered in elaborate runes and filigree. According to legend, this is the very silver hand that was made by Creidnhe and attached by Dian Cecht to replace the great King Nuada's hand, lost in battle to the Fir Bolg champion Sreng.
column3: Cette main prothétique ornée est fabriquée en argent pur et couverte de runes et de filigranes élaborés. Selon la légende, c'est la main très argentée qui a été faite par Creidnhe et attachée par Dian Cecht pour remplacer la main du grand roi Nuada, perdue au combat contre le champion de Fir Bolg Sreng.

column2: Gae Assail
column3: Gae Assail

column2: The spear of Lugh, Gae Assail is said to be "impossible to overcome" and that certain magic words could guarantee it would hit it's target when thrown and to have it return magically to the wielders hands.
column3: La lance de Lugh, Gae Assail, est dite "impossible à vaincre" et que certains mots magiques pourraient garantir qu'elle atteindrait sa cible une fois lancée et qu'elle reviendrait magiquement entre les mains des maîtres.

column2: Y Tair Tonnau
column3: Y Tair Tonnau

column2: The Three Waves, the trident of Britannia. Britannic scripture says Britannia used Y Tair Tonnau to create the world out of the primordial ocean. The first prong raised the land from the depths, the second created the lakes and rivers, the third created life. The trident knows it's true master is The Holy Mother, and will not give it's tremendous powers to anyone else. Even without such powerful magic, The Three Waves is a formidable weapon.
column3: Les Trois Vagues, le trident de Britannia. Les écritures britanniques disent que Britannia a utilisé Y Tair Tonnau pour créer le monde à partir de l'océan primordial. Le premier volet a soulevé la terre des profondeurs, le deuxième a créé les lacs et les rivières, le troisième a créé la vie. Le trident sait que son vrai maître est la Sainte Mère, et qu'il ne donnera pas ses énormes pouvoirs à qui que ce soit d'autre. Même sans une telle magie puissante, Les Trois Vagues est une arme redoutable.

column2: Britannia's Helm
column3: Heaume de Britannia

column2: This Corinthian style helmet is covered in beautiful imagery of waves and clouds. Many say this is the helm of the Holy Mother herself.
column3: Ce casque de style corinthien est couvert de belles images de vagues et de nuages. Beaucoup disent que c'est le heaume de la Sainte Mère elle-même.

column2: Britannia's Shield
column3: Bouclier de Britannia

column2: This large oval shield is made of bronze masterfully crafted onto a back of superb oak. The front bears an image of the white cliffs of Dover holding back a large wave. This shield is said to have been gifted to a mortal champion by Britannia herself.
column3: Ce grand bouclier ovale est fait de bronze magistralement façonné sur un fond de chêne superbe. Le front porte une image des falaises blanches de Douvres qui retiennent une grande vague. Ce bouclier aurait été offert à un champion mortel par Britannia elle-même.

column2: Skull of Brigid
column3: Crâne de Brigid

column2: This plain skull is held in an ornate box that claims the contents to be the remains of none other than Brigid, considered a goddess by the Druids and a saint to Christians and Britannia's followers alike.
column3: Ce crâne simple est tenu dans une boîte ornée qui prétend que le contenu n'est autre que celui de Brigid, considérée comme une déesse par les Druides et un saint pour les chrétiens et les disciples de Britannia.

column2: Horn of Bran Galed
column3: Corne de Bran Galed

column2: According to legend, this ancient drinking horn belonged to Bran “The Stingy” Galed, and had the power to create any drink the holder desired. He was tricked out of it by Myrdinn, who secreted it away with the other 13 Treasures of Britain. In the intervening centuries it's been turned into a battle horn.
column3: Selon la légende, cette ancienne corne à boire appartenait à Bran "le Nerveux" Galed, et avait le pouvoir de créer toute boisson que le détenteur désirait. Myrdinn l'a piégé et l'a caché avec les 13 autres trésors de l'Angleterre. Au cours des siècles qui ont suivi, elle a été transformée en corne de guerre.

column2: Tusk of Torc Triath
column3: Brosme de Torc Triath

column2: According to legend, this horn was created from the tusk of Torc Triath, King of the Boars. Torc Triath was hunted by King Arthur himself, aided by his loyal hunting hound Cabal.
column3: Selon la légende, cette corne a été créée à partir de la défense de Torc Triath, roi des sangliers. Torc Triath a été chassé par le roi Arthur lui-même, aidé par son fidèle chien de chasse Cabal.

column2: Queen Boudicca's Torque
column3: Le torque de la reine Boudicca

column2: The main part of this golden torque is formed from 64 individual gold wires wound into 8 cords, which are then wound together again. Beautifully molded end-pieces feature swirls and horses. Allegedly, it once belonged to Boudicca, the warrior Queen of the Iceni people.
column3: La partie principale de ce torque doré est formée de 64 fils d'or individuels enroulés en 8 cordons, qui sont ensuite enroulés de nouveau ensemble. Les embouts magnifiquement moulés présentent des tourbillons et des chevaux. Il aurait appartenu à Boudicca, la reine guerrière du peuple Iceni.

column2: Ancient Carnyx
column3: Carnyx antique

column2: This ancient horn is subtly 's' shaped, the bell at the top shaped like a ferocious boar. Centuries ago the celtic tribes used these to communicate across the battlefield, the elevated position of the horn allowing the sound to travel far and wide.
column3: Cette ancienne corne est subtilement en forme de 's', la cloche au sommet ayant la forme d'un sanglier féroce. Il y a des siècles, les tribus celtes les utilisaient pour communiquer à travers le champ de bataille, la position élevée du klaxon permettant au son de voyager loin et largement.

column2: Horned Helm
column3: Heaume à cornes

column2: This helmet is centuries old, if not over a millenia. It was probably a prized posession of a celtic tribal chief, but the strange horns look silly by modern standards.
column3: Ce casque a des siècles, voire des millénaires. C'était probablement une posession prisée d'un chef de tribu celtique, mais les cornes étranges ont l'air ridicules par rapport aux standards modernes.

column2: Battersea Shield
column3: Bouclier de Battersea

column2: This bronze tower shield is masterfully decorated. Pieces of colored enamel still cling to their fittings even after centuries at the bottom of a river.
column3: Ce bouclier de tour en bronze est magistralement décoré. Des morceaux d'émail coloré s'accrochent encore à leurs accessoires même après des siècles au fond d'une rivière.

column2: Crown of Oak
column3: Couronne de chêne

column2: The sacred crown worn by the reigning Myrdinn, head of the Druidic faith.
column3: La couronne sacrée portée par le Myrdinn régnant, chef de la foi druidique.

column2: Torque of Splendour
column3: Torque de splendeur

column2: Images of mighty beasts holding rubies, emeralds and sapphires decorate this masterpiece of goldsmithing.
column3: Des images de bêtes puissantes tenant des rubis, des émeraudes et des saphirs ornent ce chef-d'œuvre de l'orfèvrerie.

column2: Torque of Splendour
column3: Torque de splendeur

column2: Images of mighty beasts holding rubies, emeralds and sapphires decorate this masterpiece of goldsmithing.
column3: Des images de bêtes puissantes tenant des rubis, des émeraudes et des saphirs ornent ce chef-d'œuvre de l'orfèvrerie.

column2: Burning Torque
column3: Torque brulant

column2: Masterfully crafted, this torque is of finest gold twisted into a beautiful flowing loop, arcs of flame made of opals, tigers-eye and rubies emerging here and there from between the coils.
column3: Magistralement travaillé, ce collier est d'or fin torsadé en une belle boucle fluide, des arcs de flamme faits d'opales, d'yeux de tigre et de rubis émergeant ici et là d'entre les spirales.

column2: Torque of the Silvery Moon
column3: Torque de la lune argentée

column2: This open loop of silver is decorated with small diamonds embedded in the twisted strands. Each diamond represents a different phase of the moon.
column3: Cette boucle ouverte en argent est ornée de petits diamants incrustés dans les fils torsadés. Chaque diamant représente une phase différente de la lune.

column2: Nimean Lionskin
column3: Peau de lion de Némée

column2: This hooded cloak has been made from the hide of a large, black-maned lion. The skull has been fitted with a padded leather cap to serve as a helm. Many believe this to be the Nimean Lion's skin, the very hide worn by Heracles during his final 11 labors.
column3: Ce manteau à capuchon a été fabriqué à partir de la peau d'un grand lion à crinière noire. Le crâne a été équipé d'une casquette en cuir rembourrée pour servir de barre à roue. Beaucoup pensent que c'est la peau du lion de Némée, la peau que porte Héraclès durant ses 11 derniers travaux.

column2: Kronium
column3: Kronium

column2: This large, uncut ruby is dark and lumpy, with sharp edges here and there. It gives the general impression of a scab or blood clot. Perhaps this is why the gem is believed to be the blood of Kronos, shed from wounds endured in the Titanomachy and crystalized over the millenia. No one knows how many of these stones exist, but they are greatly prized by the titan's worshippers.
column3: Ce gros rubis non taillé est foncé et grumeleux, avec des arêtes vives ici et là. Elle donne l'impression générale d'une croûte ou d'un caillot de sang. C'est peut-être pour cette raison que l'on croit que la pierre précieuse est le sang de Kronos, versé des plaies endurées dans la Titanomachie et cristallisé depuis des milliers d'années. Personne ne sait combien de ces pierres existent, mais elles sont très prisées par les adorateurs du titan.

column2: Bloody Robes of Caesar
column3: Robes ensanglantées de César

column2: This bloodstained toga is said to be the very same one worn by Gaius Julius Caesar the day he was assassinated. Caesar was deified after his death, making these robes one of the holiest objects in Roman religion.
column3: Cette toge tachée de sang serait la même que celle portée par Gaius Jules César le jour de son assassinat. César a été déifié après sa mort, faisant de ces robes un des objets les plus sacrés de la religion romaine.

column2: Aethonian Feather
column3: Plume aéthonienne

column2: This huge reddish-brown feather is said to have come from the great eagle, Aethon, that tormented Prometheus by eating his liver every day for 30,000 years. Prometheans are, understandably, offended by it's very existence.
column3: On dit que cette énorme plume rouge-brune provient du grand aigle, Éthon, qui tourmenta Prométhée en mangeant son foie chaque jour pendant 30 000 ans. Les prométhéens sont, à juste titre, offensés par son existence même.

column2: Achilles Shield
column3: Bouclier d'Achille

column2: The shield given to Achilles by Hephaestus, at the bidding of his mother Thetis. It has been reforged from fragments and is a splendid piece of craftsmanship.
column3: Le bouclier donné à Achille par Héphaïstos, sur l'ordre de sa mère Thetis. Il a été reforgé à partir de fragments et c'est une magnifique pièce d'artisanat.

column2: Hector's Armor
column3: L'armure d'Hector

column2: A breastplate of hardened, oil-brushed bronze fitted to well-made leather armor. A large Iota embossed on the front in gold declares allegiance to Ilium. This armor is believed to be that worn by Hector. As told in The Iliad it was taken by Achilles after he defeated Hector, and until now it was lost to history.
column3: Une cuirasse en bronze durci, brossé à l'huile, montée sur une armure de cuir bien fait. Un grand Iota estampé sur le devant en or sur le devant déclare allégeance à Ilium. Cette armure serait celle d'Hector. Comme le raconte l'Iliade, elle a été prise par Achille après qu'il eut vaincu Hector, et jusqu'à présent elle était perdue dans l'histoire.

column2: Odysseus' Bow
column3: Arc d'Ulysse

column2: This large, black recurve bow is made of many layers of horn glued together. The curve is more dramatic than normal, requiring tremendous strength to string and draw. This has been taken to mean it is the bow of Odysseus himself, the legendary hero of The Odyssey.
column3: Ce grand arc recourbé noir est fait de plusieurs couches de corne collées ensemble. La courbe est plus spectaculaire que d'habitude, ce qui exige beaucoup de force pour enfiler et dégainer. Ceci a été pris pour signifier que c'est l'arc d'Ulysse lui-même, le héros légendaire de l'Odyssée.

column2: Death Mask of Agamemnon
column3: Masque de la mort d'Agamemnon

column2: This golden mask adorned the head of Agamemnon's coffin.
column3: Ce masque doré ornait la tête du cercueil d'Agamemnon.

column2: Crown of Theseus
column3: Couronne de Thésée

column2: This circlet of white gold and blue sapphires is said to have belonged to Theseus, the mythical founder of Athens.
column3: Ce cercle d'or blanc et de saphirs bleus aurait appartenu à Thésée, le fondateur mythique d'Athènes.

column2: Skull of Alexander the Great
column3: Crâne d'Alexandre le Grand

column2: This skull is believed to be the only surviving remains of Alexander the Great, secreted away from his tomb in Alexandria by devoted worshipers during a siege.
column3: On pense que ce crâne est le seul vestige d'Alexandre le Grand, caché de sa tombe à Alexandrie par des adorateurs dévoués au cours d'un siège.

column2: Alexander the Great's Armor
column3: Armure d'Alexandre le Grand

column2: This breastplate encompasses form and function in one. Beautifully made and strong, it is well-suited for a warrior king wishing to leave an impression of grandeur. No one is sure when it was separated from his body, nor how it ended up where it was found.
column3: Ce plastron réunit forme et fonction en une seule pièce. Magnifiquement fabriqué et solide, il convient parfaitement à un roi guerrier désireux de laisser une impression de grandeur. Personne ne sait quand il a été séparé de son corps, ni comment il a fini là où il a été trouvé.

column2: Golden Amphora
column3: Amphore dorée

column2: This ancient amphora is made of high quality gold. It is said to bring prosperity to it's owner.
column3: Cette ancienne amphore est faite d'or de haute qualité. On dit qu'il apporte la prospérité à son propriétaire.

column2: Sphinx Claw
column3: Griffe de Sphinx

column2: A huge claw, jet-black and incredibly sharp. Said to be from the paw of a sphinx slain by some hero in ancient times.
column3: Une griffe énorme, d'un noir de jais et d'une acuité incroyable. On dit qu'il vient de la patte d'un sphinx tué par un héros dans l'antiquité.

column2: Golden Apple
column3: Pomme d'or

column2: An apple made of solid gold. Some say that the cursed touch of King Midas created this apple. Others say that it is the Apple of Discord which Eris threw onto Olympus, ultimately leading to the Trojan War.
column3: Une pomme en or massif. Certains disent que la touche maudite du roi Midas a créé cette pomme. D'autres disent que c'est la pomme de discorde qu'Eris a jetée sur l'Olympe, conduisant finalement à la guerre de Troie.

column2: Corinthian Helm
column3: Heaume corinthien

column2: An ancient relic, this helm belonged to a great warrior or prince.
column3: Ancienne relique, ce gouvernail appartenait à un grand guerrier ou prince.

column2: Petrified Tongue of an Oracle
column3: Langue pétrifiée d'un oracle

column2: A small stone said to be the petrified tongue of an ancient oracle. The power of the oracle is supposed to sharpen the tongue of the one who holds this artifact.
column3: Une petite pierre qui serait la langue pétrifiée d'un ancien oracle. Le pouvoir de l'oracle est censé aiguiser la langue de celui qui tient cet artefact.

column2: Silver Amphora
column3: Amphore d'argent

column2: A beautiful amphora made from fine silver and decorated with reliefs of humans and satyrs celebrating a bountiful harvest at the feet of Demeter.
column3: Une belle amphore en argent fin ornée de reliefs d'humains et de satyres célébrant une moisson abondante aux pieds de Déméter.

column2: Shard of Achilles Shield
column3: Éclat de bouclier d'Achille

column2: This shard of metal bares reliefs of battle scenes that match the descriptions of Achilles shield from The Illiad. Perhaps if you found more...
column3: Cet éclat de métal met en évidence des reliefs de scènes de bataille qui correspondent aux descriptions du bouclier d'Achille de l'Illiade. Peut-être que si vous en trouviez plus....

column2: Crown of Upper and Lower Egypt
column3: Couronne de Haute- et Basse-Égypte

column2: The sacred crown worn by the reigning Pharoah, head of the Kemetic faith.
column3: La couronne sacrée portée par le pharaon régnant, chef de la foi kémitique.

column2: Sunburst Crown
column3: Couronne de la percée de rayons du soleil

column2: The sacred crown worn by the reigning Meryaten, head of the Atenic faith.
column3: La couronne sacrée portée par le Meryaten régnant, chef de la foi atonienne.

column2: Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a reliquary within which lies a skull. This skull, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, is none other than that of St Brigid of Kildare!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small box, within which lies an ornately engraved hand made of silver. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the hand that was forged for Nuada after he lost is real one in battle!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a beautiful trident decorated with ocean motifs. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, Y Tair Tonnau "The Three Waves", the very trident Britannia used to create the world!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a leather bag, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls an ornate corinthian helm. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the blessed helm of Britannia!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a large object wrapped in furs, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a large shield emblazoned with the crest of The Holy Mother. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the holy Shield of Britannia!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a gilded horn with images of flowing ale on it's sides. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the Horn of Bran Galed!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls an ivory horn engraved with images of mighty warriors locked in battle with a titanic boar. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the Tusk of Torc Triath!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a golden torque formed from many gold wires wound together. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the Torque of Boudicca, warrior queen of the Iceni!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a large object wrapped in leathers, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a long battle horn ending in the open mouth of a bronze boar. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, a Carnyx battle horn used by ancient warriors!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls an iron helm with strange, large horns. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the helm of an ancient celtic warrior prince!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a huge chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a bronze tower shield beautifully embossed and decorated with red enamel. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, a blessed shield that belonged to an ancient druid!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a large chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls the skin of a lion with a jet black mane. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the skin of the Nimean Lion!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls large, red, uncut gem. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the crystalized blood of Kronos, shed in the Titanomachy and known as Kronium!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a bloody toga. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the very robes Caesar wore whe he was assassinated!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls what seems to be an impossibly large eagle's feather. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, a feather from the titanic eagle Aethon!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls what seems to be a piece of a shattered shield. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, a fragmet from the shield of Achilles!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a large chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls a black and gold breastplate. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, Hector of Troy's breastplate!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] pulls what seems to be a large, thick recurve bow. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the bow of the great hero Odysseus!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a thin gold mask. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the death mask of Agamemnon!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a silver circlet set with sapphires. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the crown of Theseus, founder of Athens!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a reliquary, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals an ancient looking skull. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the last known remains of Alexander the Great!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a large chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a set of ancient looking bronze armor. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, Alexander the Great's armor!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals an amphora of pure gold. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, a Golden Amphora, blessed by the gods!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a silk bag, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a huge black claw. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, a claw from the sphinx that Oedipus defeated in a battle of wits!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a golden apple. This, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, was created by the cursed touch of Midas!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a helm in the style of ancient Corinth. This, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, once belonged to a great king!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a reliquary, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals a small oblong stone. This is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, the petrified tongue of an ancient oracle!

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] a small chest, from which [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] reveals an amphora of pure silver. This amphora is, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] claims, blessed by Demeter!
